snippet: Former President Jimmy Carter said he doubted that Egypt’s military rulers would fully submit to the civilian democracy they had promised to install, but he expressed optimism about the transition.
abstract: Former President Jimmy Carter says that after meeting with Egypt’s military rulers he doubts they will fully submit to the civilian democracy they promised to install, but he still expresses optimism about the transition.
lead_paragraph: Former President Jimmy Carter said he doubted that Egypt’s military rulers would fully submit to the civilian democracy they had promised to install, but he expressed optimism about the transition.

headline.seo: Carter Expects Egypt’s Military to Keep Some Powers
headline.main: Carter Says Egypt’s Military Is Likely to Retain Some Political Powers
headline.print_headline: Carter Says Egypt’s Military Is Likely To Hold On to Some Political Powers

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
